result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesus Abraham Colorado-Mendoza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jesus Abraham Colorado-Mendoza
parties.address: P.O. Box 152, c/o John Mendez, Abbotsford, WI 54405

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The cash bond of $100.00 was applied towards the costs.  The costs shall be paid at the rate of $100.00 a month beginning October 1, 2015.  Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.

The defendant is sentenced to time served.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

records.addlTxt: Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

Defendant Jesus Abraham Colorado-Mendoza in court with attorney Peter Joseph Prusinski.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn in Interpreter.  Plea agreement put into the record. Victim rights have been complied with.   Plea of guilty to charge of disorderly conduct.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; time served 26 days jail - 26 days sentence credit.   The costs shall be paid at the rate of $100.00 a month beginning October 1, 2015. - rt

Defendant Jesus Abraham Colorado-Mendoza in court with attorney Peter Joseph Prusinski.  Defendant Jesus Abraham Colorado-Mendoza in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn in Interpreter.  Waive reading of complaint.  Plea of not guilty to the charge.  Demand for speed trial filed with the court.  Would like jury trial scheduled within 60 days.  Attorney Prusinski is requesting that the bond be amended.  Argument by parties.  Court denies request to amend bond.  Bond continued.  Attorney Prusinski will schedule matter with judicial assistant.  - rt
to Extend Time to File Pre-trial Motions

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall have no contact with C.G.W. dob: 2-23-1978 and J.B-H. dob: 1-09-1983.

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall have no contact with C.G.W. d.o.b. 2-23-1978 and J.B.H. d.o.b. 1-9-1983.
Initial Appearance on August 25, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared in court, in custody.  Spanish interpreter was sworn in.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $100.00 cash bond; booking; no possession or consumption of alcohol and no contact with C.W. and J.B.H.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Next court date is August 25, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.  - rt
